intro: Echeandia luteola, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky areas. It has a low, spreading growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Echeandia luteola is often found in disturbed or open habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
